text: Bottle at WTF 3. Pours a dark brown with medium tan head that lasts. The aroma is strong roast, chocolate, booze. Medium body, sweet roast, dark chocolate, boozy finish, very good.

Tap at brewery. Pours opaque black. Aroma is chocolate, light coffee, faint roast, dark fruit, and some spice. Flavor is rich dark chocolate and roasted coffee, earthy bitterness throughout, and a soft ashy finish. Creamy, full body.

Draft at the brewery. Pours dark opaque brown with a creamy brown head. Tastes like dark roasted malt, booze, burnt toast, creamy chocolate, and light ash. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like dark roasted malt, chocolate, creamy, and light ash.

22oz bottle (from 2012) in a tulip. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, some chocolate and coffee, some light sweet notes, and some dough. Flavor the same with a nice blend of everything you want from dark malts. Smoother texture. A solid beer.

On tap at Whats Brewing 2015
Black, thin tanned head. Smell of roast, toast, chocolate, dark malts. Medium sweet, roast, coffee, quite clean, not much yeast influence, dark dark malts. Moderate bitter finish. Great stuff
On tap at Whats Brewing Beer Festival 2015, Stavanger. Pours black with brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malts. Some sweetness, some roasted bitterness. Medium bodied.

Bottle. All black body with a tiny brown head. Aroma is a licorice bomb with roasted malt and ash. Taste is sweet and roasty, dark, with bitter chocolate and tobacco. Mild warm alcoholic finish. A full bodied tasty porter.

Bottle... Pours thick, murky and black with a small, brown head. The olfactory standouts here are fudge, blackstrap molasses and dried plum. Full-bodied and super velvety with modest carbonation. The flavor is a bold swirl of burnt caramel, charcoal, pouch tobacco and dried plum. Bittersweet, scorched, acrid finish. Bottle courtesy of ctipping!

65cl bottle served in a snifter. Pours pitch black with a dark tan head which lasts a while. Aroma is powerful burnt malt and dark fruits. Taste is dark chocolate, vanilla and espresso coffee with quite a harsh bitterness and dryness. As it warms up the dark chocolate melds into a milk chocolate creaminess with the vanilla becoming more pronounced. Mouthfeel is medium and overall this is one of the finest imperial stouts I have tried and certainly one that I will buy again. Bottled in 2012.

Bomber share @ SHAPE NFL Fantasy Draft. Thanks Steven.
Bottled 12/18/2012.
Brune foncée, col crémeux café au lait et doré au verre.
Arôme offre un bouquet épais au niveau malté, retrouve as mal de chocolat, le tout gardant un léger rétro fruité noir/rouge.
Palais est maté également assez épais, caramel dont les 10% se font bien sentir. Le tout reste sec, petite touche rappelant le tourbé et une fin de bouche réchauffante. Pas grand chose en terme houblonné amertume mais un côté fruité noir indique que lon est bien dans un style baltique. Reste néanmoins assez basique dans son style avec un penchant fort axé sur les malts.

Pours a deep black from a growler with minimal head or lace. Aroma of sweet chocolate and big fruity sweetness. Tasteis more roasty than the nose, but still nice chocolate and fruity esters. Thin, but still viscous, really nice.

Bottle from Dec 2012. Black oily colour with dark tan head that fades to a thin slick aroma is roasty , coffee and chocolate Amazing taste initially smooth dark chocolate and toasted malt gicing way to a more acidic clean bitter coffee with crisp finish. Long aftertaste - really long aftertaste - all those complex flavours just hanging around keeping the tastebuds watering. Nice alcohol warmth comes in. Smooth plate low carbonation very rich damn fine beer

Bottle thanks to ygtbsm94 shared at Anchorage Dec 14 Tasting: Poured a dark brown with red edges and thin head. Aroma was veggie, malt, and chocolate. Taste was chocolate, malts, and boozy/stickiness.

Backlog rate from the spring; bomber into goblet. Dark brown pour, head dies. Lovely chocolate and light coffee roast nose, tastes sweet chocolate, dark caramel, bitter roast, coffee, hint of vanilla. Medium body (light for the style), creamy smooth, soft carbonation. Delicious and easy-drinking.

Bottled on 2012-12-18. Black with a large creamy dark brown head. Vanilla, molasses/brown sugar, dark chocolate, roasted malt, coffee. Full body, syrupy texture, soft carbonation, heavy sweet and medium bitter, light acidic. Warming alcohol. Big and sticky, wears me out but fine in small amounts.

Reviewed from notes. This was received in a trade.
This was poured into a nonic pint glass and a snifter.
There wasnt any difference between the two glasses.
The appearance was a fairly decent dark brown to black color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within less than a minute gracing the glass with some fairly nice clinging lacing in a spider web fashion.
The smell had a good about of licorice, light coffee, light milk chocolate with some booziness swirling around together underneath my nose.
The taste was sweet and boozy around the chocolate, coffee and alcohol. There was a light sticky boozy chocolate aftertaste and a dry coffee/chocolatey finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with more of a sippers type of quality to it. The carbonation seemed fairly light, but thats okay, its nothing that was bad.
Overall, what a nice Baltic Porter I would have again.

Beautiful initial pour leading towards a large toasty, earthy and dark fruit character. You do indeed get lager yeast esters and brash alcohol. This was bottled 12/18/12 and does have a touch of that "aged" tone which works nicely here.

May Ale Alpharetta. While this is better than the bourbon version I had in a cask, this beer just doesnt tickle my fancy. And I am a Westbrook fanboy. Chocolate, licorice, lots of dark fruits, and the yeast is working against my palate. Nice thick palate, but the flavors just arent there for me.

Bottle thanks to wyzzywyz22, good night at his. Poured a dark brown with a medium beige head. Aroma of sweet chocolate malts, nice boozy notes. Flavour is more chocolate, roasted malts, hints of fruit. Has nice notes of alcohol that compliment it well. Good stuff.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika. Black color , good foam. Roasted aromas, licorice, leather, malt & dried fruit. Full body & high complexity. Some sweetness, well balanced . Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Nearly black. Espresso top coloured, thin, tight, lasting head. Light coffee. Liquorice. Cocoa powder. Some granary bread. Taste is dark chocolate sweet. Some hazelnut paste. After that, loads of well done bread bitterness. Thick, oily, chocolate palate. Fudgy sweetness on the finish, soon followed by a big, charred bitterness. A beer of two halves. Stupid easy to drink.
Bottle at the Triad bottle share at Foothills organized by Mike. Dark chocolate heavy with a nice warming grainy presence. Borders on feeling hot at times. Solid.
Bottle. Black colour with a brown head. Aroma is alcohol, licorice, coffee, molasses. Flavour is alcohol, licorice, coffee, roasted malt, molasses. Boozy nice beer.

66cl Bottle at Beer Temple. Black colour, khaki-brown head. Aroma is quite sweet, molasses/treacle, sweet chocolate, pumpernickel, roasted malts, hint of coffee. Flavour is quite sweet at first as well, roasted malts, treacle, pumpernickel, laurel, chocolate, firm roasted bitter finish with some hops. Full-bodied, slick, sticky. A little too sweet imho, but quite nice as well.
A big bold beer just how I like em. Full of chocolate, molasses. Thick black oily pour. Wonderful beer.
Drank @ Beertemple. Aroma is chocolate, liquorice, burned molasses, fruity caramel. Flavour is huge roasty liquorice, molasses and black malts. Very nice.

Bottle, from BOE, split at JFs - 26/12/13.
Deep black with a good sized dirty tan head that eventually dissipates to a pond.
Nose is rich chocolate, light smoke, chocolate milkshake, earthy, dark toffee fudge.
Taste comprises big roast malts, erthy cocoa powder, rich chocolate, earthy, maltesers, dark malts.
Medium bodied with bite, soft carbonation, smooth on the palate, sweet in the finale.
Nice Baltic Porter, good balance and easy drinking.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: A monster indeed. Thick, full-bodied beer. Strong roasted malt, but also with some hops. Very good.

Bottle, 22oz. It pours a pitch black body and a dark tan head that dissapates quite soon. Molasses, roasted malts, licorice, tar hints and coffee in the aroma. Alcohol notes too. Its full-bodied and warming on the palate, a bit sweetish. Licorice, roasted malts, molasses, tar and coffee in the flavor. Some bitterness. Lasting warming finish with roasted malts and licorice. A pretty pleasant one, but a bit too alcoholic. 131228

Bottle. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of malt, roasted malt, chocolate, soy sauce and coffee. Flavor is sweet and maly with some licorice, roasted malt, chocolate, warming alcohol, coffee and red fruits. Full body, average carbonation.

Bottle 650ml @ gynnfryd
Pours pitch black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, molasses, licorice, chocolate and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long warm, roasty, chocolate and licorice finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is flat to soft.

22oz bomber pours with a deep dark body that supports a mocha colored head of foam. The aroma offers up dark roasted malts, earthy dark chocolate, some chocolate brownie and then a light amount of molasses. The taste delivers rich malt deepened dark roasted malts mixed with dark chocolate goodness and then getting into some vanilla bean and spicy black strap molasses. Wow! This is dynamite dark roasted goodness. Great stuff.

650 ml bottle shared from Beer&Deli. Excellent black colour with a nice brown head. The aromas were nice with hints of coffee at first and maybe some chocolate as the beer got warmer. The taste was not so good. The alcohol was overwhelming everything else. Only warmer could you understand some coffee and roasted notes. The body was nice and so was carbonation. A dissapointment, despite al the good words i have heard!!

Medium to light body with a thin layer of brown foam on top. The aroma is of dark coffee and alcohol, maybe some cognac. Tastes like alcohol, vodka, brandy, dark coffee with hints of chocolate. Bitterish aftertaste.

Bottle, De Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Deep dark brown pour with a beige head. Plenty of dark choc and roasted malt evident in the nose. Thick, smooth mouthfeel. Rich flavour of dark fruit, more choc nroast, booze and some hop making its presence known towards the finish. Extremely tasty offering.

Bottle shared at Natifest. Pours a dark brown to black color with a small khaki head. The aroma and flavor have roasted malt, dark chocolate, dark frui, hints of coffee, sticky at times, some caramel pops up with the alcohol being warming. This was very tasty.

Bottle 22fl.oz. @ [ Craig and Fin Sneak up in the middle of the NIGHT and drink all fonefans beer ].Clear dark brown black colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, light brown head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, chocolate, dark chocolate, cacao. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, chocolate, dark chocolate, cacao, dry. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130519]
Bottle cracked at Beer Temple. pours black with very tiny head, notes of dark chocolate, anis, licorice, fig, and syrup. Medium bodied. Not too sticky. Very nice stout from Westbrook.

Bottle thanks to kermis. Pours very dark brown with not much head at all. Aroma is big liquorice, roasted malts, boozy and some coffee. Taste is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.
Poured virtually black with a small beige ring. Aroma of sweet vanilla and roast malt. Full body, flavour is heavy creme Brule, deep roasted malt, coffee grinds.

66cl bottle courtesy of and shared with kermis. 
Very thin off white head. Clear black pour. Lots of chocolate. Lovely brew

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
Pitch black color, small steady brownish head. Loas of licorice in the nose, a bit sweetish. Full-bodied. Roasted, licorice, some alcohol. Very nice roasted impy.

Draught at Beer Temple, Amsterdam. Pours black in color with a tan head. Roasted 
notes, coffee, burnt wood, some tobacco and chocolate in aroma. Roasted coffee 

and chocolate mixed with licorice in taste. Great brew.
Sampled this one wandering around the line on Darkness Eve 2013. Just missed the Mexican Cake poured right before this. Roasty stout with hidden alcohol.

Bomber pours a dark brown/black with a medium reddish tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, leather, sweet wet tobacco, caramel, and alcohol, reminds me of wet dog food. Taste of sweet chocolate, mild dark fruits, finishing with dry leather tobacco and coffee. Nice!
amazing beer. black,creamy,smooth,chocolate,coffee..super nice aftertaste and a full mouth body
Bottle at Darkness Day. Pours a dark black with brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, bitter cocoa and vanilla. Flavor is similar to aroma but with a bit of coffee. Sweet with a medium palate.
Bottle. Dark brown pour. Small head. Sweet fruit nose and taste. Caramel malts. Nice.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Valkendorfsgate, Bergen. Pours a magnificent oily black body with a large, creamy caramel-colored, long-lasting head. Nose is dark chocolate, brandy, leather, coffee and hints of licorice, caramel and alcohol. Taste is coffee and brandy up front, then dark chocolate and sweet malts come in before a bit of leather and licorice in the finish. Smooth, velvety full body and soft to medium carbonation. A very nice Baltic Porter from Westbrook.

Impressive looking thick, black and with a lasting, thick and creamy dark tanned head. Roasty aroma, light fruity alcohol notes. liquorice tasting up front, malty caramel with a slight burn in the back. Bitter dark chocolate and coffee aftertaste.

Pitch black colour, medium dark brown head. Nice roasted malty aroma with coffee, licorice, red grapes, herbal notes as well as a slight medicinal one, as well as some ash, vanilla. Smooth, easy drinking. Heavy roasted malty flavour with chocolate, coffee, some ash, licorice, tobacco, biscuits, red grapes, almonds. Somewhat peculiar but a great beer nonetheless.

I enjoyed this brew while watching the penultimate episode of Breaking Bad. Going to be tough for the beer I drink during the finale to top this one. Pours a deep dark brown with a tinge of red. Tan head. Chocolate dominates the nose with a feint hint of grape. Flavor starts earthy and chocolately and finishes with a bit of bitterness. Thick like a milkshake. Bottle - Filet & Vine - Montgomery, AL

Bottle (22 oz). Shared by Marc-Olivier, thanks! Reddish black with a small persistent beige/brown head and little lacing. Aroma of chocolate, herbal notes, fruits and hops. Taste is moderately sweet with a lot of chocolate, fruity notes and some herbal notes. Alcohol is well hidden. Medium to full body. Moderate carbonation. Thick mouthfeel. Complex and enjoyable Baltic Porter. Not cloying.

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013. This is a black one. Yeah, really black actually and the nice lady who poured this to me gave it a medium sized brown top that looks like a million bucks. . The aroma has tones of ashtray and heavy roasted almost burned malts. Some lactose and a milky sweetness shines through with milk chocolate and more roasted things. Great taste also. No doubt that this has been in contact with wood, so much is clear, and its not directly sweet but it has a milky chocolaty sweetness to it. Lots if roasted stuff going on here. Some nice sweet biscuits in the roasted finish. A really tasty one. 03.05.2013

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2013 Updated from bottel. Pitch black.  nice dark head that stays.  Pretty awesome.

Rasberry flavor rich dark taste. Enjoyable beer with non stellar aroma. Sweetness is nice. But not to great.
Sheeees a gushaaaaa!!!! Wort gusher \I have had. The entire bottle. Infected too.,
CBC 2013. Pours pitch black with a great brown lacing head.Aroma is roasted malty sweet ashy acidy. Flavor is heavily roasted malty velvety sweet fruity and nicely bitter.

Pitch black body yields foamy espresso head. Sticky beads of lace adorn my teku. Gorgeous! 

Rich, yet dry, coffee-infused roasty malt aroma. Taste opens up with espresso and boozy chocolate malt, turns sweet briefly before finishing dry. In short: Wow! This is excellent. 

It isn't often I'm this impressed by a stout, but Ballistic Stout is deserving.

Dark mahogany pour with a midnight core. Small latte head that diminished to a wisp and a ring. Nose is of cocoa, soy, vanilla, and dark fruit. Flavor filled with shoyu...Kikkoman through and through. Some brownie batter and fudge, but tons of briney qualities. Sticky and coating. Molasses, caramel, and salt-water taffy.  An interesting take on a Baltic Porter.
Bottle pour at Natifest 2013. Pours opaque black. Nose syrupy malt, slight booze, dark fruit, and roast. Taste strong roast, chocolate, and nice bitter finish. Smooth mouthfeel.

Bomber, bottled Dec 2012. Pours black with a small foamy head that quickly fades and leaves some minor webbing. Nice rich aroma of chocolate, coffee, currants, tobacco, cookie dough, and vanilla. Taste has some light chocolaty sweetness mixed with a strong, bitter roasted coffee. Lots of tobacco, raisins, cookies, currants. Delicious. Long bitter finish with a slightly spicy kick, not sure if thats hops, rye, or something else. Thick body with a smooth creamy and oily mouthfeel. Awesome beer. I want to get another of these.

22 oz. bottle shared at Natifest- I missed who opened this, though. Pours a near-black color, opaque, with a small tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, molasses, syrup, and roasted malts. The flavor is the same. Full-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a sweet, smooth, roasty mouthfeel. Really nice, big, bold Baltic porter.
Bottle shared at natifest. Pours a thick, pitch black with a brown head of foam. Aroma has notes of chocolate, raisin, fig, and blackcurrants. Tastes earthy and toasty. Thick, viscous mouth feel.
bomber - pours black with brown head. Nose is coffee, licorice and roast. very dry. big body.

Nati fest bottle share. Pours a deep brown with Carmel colored head. Has a strong bitter chocolate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice dark brown pour with a brown head. Flavors of rich chocolate, some raisins, toasted malt, and finishes a bit dry, almost like there is some rye in it. These guys are good.

23-JUL-2013, bottle @home, from Fish & Beer. Black with dark brown, lasting head.
Roasted aroma with prunes and soy. Taste the same but better.
Sweet but with a touch of bitterness. 
Full body and soft carbonation. Often Westbrook beers have been overcarbonated but this is wonderfull.

22oz bottle poured into a tulip glass. Pours jet plack with a large tan head. Very oily inky mouthfeel. A lot of peat, earthy, cocoa, pretty harsh really. More of an imperial stout than a porter, not bad.

Jet black with a thick tan head. Disappears quick. Aroma is mainly chocolate, roasty, coffee. Taste starts smooth followed by a long long bitterness that hangs about. Im struggling to pick out flavours as the bitterness is overpowering. Oily & medium bodied.

22oz bottle pours out dark brown almost black topped with a small brown head. Aroma of booze, sweet milk chocolate, ans roast malts. Taste much as the aroma with the chocolate, leading the way, a nice bitter end.

dark brown, thin tan ring. Stale cardboard nose, faint oats and sugar with strawberry hints. Flavor is fresher, more sugar, chocolate, cardboard comes through in end. Too old, profile cant alleviate.

Bottle via trade. It pours jet black with a thick tan head. The nose is roasted malt, toast, salted caramel, dark fruit, coffe grinds, earth and light burnt notes. The taste is rich roasted malt, coffee, toast, light spice, earth, cocoa, salted caramel and dark fruit with a dry, roasty finish. Full body, moderate carbonation and velvety mouth-feel. Rich, indulgent and full on flavour. Balance is spot on. Delectable.
Black colour. Roasted malt, dark fruits aroma. Sweet, dark chocolate and coffee taste.

Bottle. Wow this was nice. Black with a small head. Chocolate and coffee were present but didnt take over, So easy to drink -you cant believe that its in double figures strength wise. One not to be missed,

Bottle at Pibar, Lausanne, bottled 12/18/12Pitch black color with no head, just a thin brown collar. Strong aroma of roasted malt, some tar, light phenol, very light banana. Thick body, just a bit oily; very good roasted malt flavor, clean, with plenty of dark chocolate, a bit salty, with some liquorice and tar, and delicate fruitiness; strong bitterness.Powerful, extreme, very pleasant. Less resiny than an Imperial Stout, but very similar.

Pour is an oily viscous pitch black color with a dark brown head. Toooons of toasted malt on the nose, dark fruit and alcohol, some milk chocolate, anise, and a hint of caramel. Really thick and rich bitter chocolate notes up front, dark roasted coffee, dark fruit quickly fades away to toasted malt, slight oakyness, and a bit of caramel and molasses. Delicious, 6 month old baltic porter. Very well balanced.
3rd May 2013CBC. 10.5%. Opaque black - brown beer, good tan head. Soft airy palate, semi dry. Minerally carbonation. Creamy dark malt. Touch of roast. Finishes semi dry with licorice and caramel,

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; deep black pour with velvety brown head, sweet roasted malt aroma, sweet to taste brown sugar a bit of bready malts, oil thick mouthfeel, earthy with a hint of vanilla, solid impy stout.

Happy Fathers Day.

Bottle courtesy of Brad. Served in Westbrook glassware, also courtesy of Brad.

The beer is black with an inch of beige head. The aroma brings chocolate, molasses, dark fruit. Beautiful balance and delicious flavor. Alcohol is evident but gracefully masked. Rich and full bodied. Abundant chocolate, both dark and milk. Palate coating and viscous. Delicious.

From bomber. Really nice nose. Chocolate, vanilla, oak, smoke, coffee, Twizzlers, molasses. Dark black opaque with thin tan head. Oily body with medium carbonation and warming. Starts and stays sweet with roasted barley, coffee, vanilla, and oak. Alcohol. Big bitter finish with lots of roasted and toasted notes. Big sweet after with smoke and tang.
Solid porter; chocolate, and coffee flavors dominate with a dry, slightly bitter cocoa finish.
Great roasty and coffee flavors, great sweet body and rich and thick. Really dig it
Bomber shared with friends at Sybarite Pig. Super dark pour with a soft foamy head. Dark chocolate aroma mixed with a tiny bit of rolled oats. Really delicious and easy to drink.

Sample at CBC 2013.

Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, burnt brown sugar, spice and nuts.

Bottled (thanks fonefan!). Pitch black colour, not much head. Aroma is liquorice, vanilla, some wood as well as mild toasted and earthy notes. Flavou ris roasted malts, wood, vanilla, mild alcohol as well as some fruity hops. Balanced, though the alcohol leaves a slight burn in the aftertaste.

22oz bottle from GBX. pours a thick, syrupy, brown that sits black in the glass capped by a dense mocha head that leaves oily stains of lace. aroma is excellent with heavy dark chocolate, fudge brownies, roasted malts, and moist earth backed by intriguing and subtle notes of black cherry, blueberry, trail mix, and bitter espresso. flavor is outstanding with rich, dark roasted malts, coffee beans, dark chocolate cake, and light peat smoke up front backed by red wine, blueberry skins, and sweet molasses. palate is full bodied and rich but the lager yeast keeps it from being syrupy and adds a fluffy texture to the mouthfeel. overall, another winner from the Westbrook guys.

What a great beer.  This brewery is doing things.  Pours jet black with lasting creamy brown head.  Aroma is cocoa, burnt toast, some herbal hoppiness, and light currants.  Really great creamy thick and rich mouthfeel.  Hugely drinkable for 10% because it isnt overly sweet.  Awesome/.

Tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013 - Session 1. Pours oily black with a thick, brown head. Lightly tangy dark malt nose. Medium to big sweet flavor with moderate roast, lots of dark sugars, dark bread, light chocolate, faint burnt wood. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Dark malt finish with dark cherries, some rich chocolate, modest earthy bitterness. Great stuff.
On tap @CBC13. Black with small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt and chocolate. Taste follows; roasted malt, chocolate and a bit bready.

Tap @ CBC 2013. The pours deep brown with a tiny head. The nose is roasted coffee. Earthy dark chocolate, ash. Some accents of vanilla. The taste is quite roasty, dry. A bit of toasted nut, caramel. Dark chocolate. Vanilla. Dry finish. Full body, warming. Overall, quite nice.

Bottle from JCB.  Thanks!  Deepest of black pour with orange-tan head.  Nose is a mix of dark, bitter chocolate, roast malt, vanilla cream, caramel, molasses, and faint, floral dark fruits.  Flavor is decadent dark chocolate, light caramel syrup, toffee, dark fruit that finishes with a mildly ashy roast and more chocolate.  Some alcohol notes throughout.  Truly a big, coating mouthfeel.  Lingering dark chocolate covered sweet caramel and dark fruit.  This is a monster indeed.  Highly recommended.
Big bottle kindly shared by my beer pal, Ole Anders. Black body with a light brown rim. Roasted, boozy, raisin sweet. Full bodied and smooth to drink.

65cl, as Westbrook Capn Skoons Ballistic Stout, new exclusive American brew Anno 2012, from Beers of Europe Setchey, very complex Stout, roasted/malty and slightly fruity/spicy, balanced, hazy, good head, very good brew, yet expensive!
Thanks for the share Matt. This porter was bold and creamy with lots of caramel and coffee finishing with a dark chocolate kiss. VERY drinkable at 10% so watch out!

Thanks, Matt, for sharing. Aroma is big roasted malt and bitter dark chocolate. Lightly fruity nose, also. Pour is oily black with a tan head. Flavor is big roast and dark chocolate, light coffee, some anise, and molasses. Nice.
From tap. Pours dark brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malty and chocolate. Roasted malty, breadish and chocolate. Lingering roasted, bitter and dry finish.
Draft. A black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of chocolate and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of chocoalte, alcohol, wood, malt, and iodine.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate aroma with hints of licorice. Roasted malty chocolate and caramel flavor. Has a roasted malty chocolate and licorice finish.

Sort skum brun lidt 
Kaffe malt træ alc citrus 
Bitter meget sød lidt 
Sirup blød 
@f1
bottle at jans ... deep black ... thin tan lacing ...deep dark roast ... heavy malt nose ... dark chocolate roast ... dark roast ... tiny charcoal ... little fizzy ... little licorice

22 oz. bottle from The Greenville Beer Exchange, Greenville, SC (bottled December 18, 2012).  Pours black with a rich brown head.  Aroma of cocoa, roasty malts, and a hint of dark fruit.  The flavor is rich with heavy amounts of roasted espresso, bitter chocolate, and roasted malt with a hint of dark fruit on the finish.  Recommended chaser, a gallon of water.  While heavy, the flavor is outstanding and this is one of the finest Baltic porters I have tried.

Bottle provided by GT2. Thanks! Poured a dark brown color, almost black with a dark tan head. Aroma is roasted, bitter chocolate notes. Flavor is light/medium chocolate notes, some touch of raspberries. A little boozy.

Growler shared by Caterwaul. Pitch black color. Dark brown head, with a hue of brick to it. Great lace. Nice big roasty malt, big dark chocolate, some bitter roasted coffee. Light dark fruit. Big bitter taste, some sweetness. Really big body, chewy, light carbonation. Kind of dry in the finish. Light sweet bite to it. Body is not as chewy or thick as most imperial stouts, carbonation is a bit strange, too... Drinks like a very full flavored baltic porer. The flavor is huge, I dont really care that the texture doesnt feel typical stout. Very interesting beer. Odd, but I cant help but dig it

Tap @ CBC 2013. Pours completely black with a small, staying, creamy dark brown head. Aroma has light chocolate, coffee, light roasted, mild nutty. Medium carbonation, nice creamy and rather dry mouthfeel. Flavour is mild smoked, burnt malts, chocolate, light roasted. Pleasant lightness to it. Really elegant. Classy.

Flaske delt med Odd Gunnar og Johnne på Cafe Viking, mai-13: denne gjorde susen! Masser av god og overbevisende portersmak. Særdeles balansert og en fryd for ganen. Kompleks, samksrik så det holder og fremdeles glir den friksjonsfritt over ganen. Nydelig.

Tap. Pours pitch black with a excellent glass coating lacing and thick dark brown frothy medium head. Aroma is licorice, burnt malt, roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, dark fruit, grass, grapefruit, noticeable lager yeast  characteristic lager yeast aromas, hops, brown sugar. Taste is medium+ sweet and medium bitter. Body is full, texture is sticky, light creamy and thick, carbonation is very soft. Finishes super roasted malty, licorice, grass and alcoholic dry. This is a fine treat.
Tap @ CBC 2013 and one of my festival favorites. Well-balanced in aroma and taste, with roasted malts, coffee, a hint of chocolate. A little sweetness and nice bitterness. Perfect!

Bottle from Greenville Beer Exchange. Pours black and viscous with an j ch of brown foam. A bit of roasted malt on the nose. Lots of raisin and licorice on the tongue. Its got some alcohol burn on the finish. Solid for style.

651mL from a trade on BA. Pours inkier black, thicker mocha foam. Nose is strawberry ice cream, strawberry milkshake, some hefty tar and green olive. Taste is dry, dusty, some harsh acid. Dry, papery palate. Was disappointing.

22oz bottle shared by GT2: pours an oily opaque with a clingy-lacing dark beige head. Has a rich sweet dark caramel malty nose with some dark fruity Noyes. Starts with good fullness and sweet dark chocolate with some dark fruits before a drier smoky and roasted finish. True to style, enjoyable and complex.
Bottle courtesy of GT2, thanks!  Muddy brown color, small tan head. Aroma of rich dark cocoa, very subtle perfume, taste is rich and roasty dark milk chocolate and subtle raspberries. Delicious.

Bottle shared by GT2. Pours opaque black with a medium, frothy brown head and light lacing. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, and roast malt with prunes, dates, and licorice with earthy hops. Flavor is dark malt dominant with dark fruits, medium hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.
UPDATED: MAY 12, 2013 Bottle share, pour is dark black with low head. Taste is sweet up front, big roast and whiskey, strange aftertaste.

Draught @ CBC. Pours pitch black with a cfreamy brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, hops. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee, burnt caramel, dark chocolate, wood, dark fruits. Full body, soft carbonation, warming alcohol. 030513

650 ml bottle, kindly shared by gunnar and our beerpal Ole Anders. ABV is 10%. Pitch black colour, moderate tan head. Excellent aroma, notes of roasted malts, tobacco and leather. Very roasty flavour, fairly sweet, but still remarkably balanced by decent hops.

Draught @ CBC2013. Pours pitch black with a dark chocolate brown head that slowly dissipates while leaving lots of trace on the glass. Smell is sweet and malty with roasted malts, dark roast coffee, bitter chocolate, charred wood, butterscotch hard candy, burnt cookies, resin and toffee. Taste is sweet, bitter and malty with roasted malts, dark roast coffee, moist soil, bitter chocolate, charred wood, resin, roasted nuts, burnt cookies and hints of caramel. Mouthfeel is soft, smooth, round and medium to full bodied. Finish is bitter with roasted malts, dark roast coffee, bitter chocolate, roasted nuts and charred wood.
Sample @ CBC. Huge head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chocolate, coffee, nuts and hops.

[5/3/13] Draught at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013. Black with a beautiful brown head. Roasty aroma, a bit vegetal. Sweet flavor, alcoholic and roasty, with chocolate and a bitter burnt finish. Full-bodied, thick and silky. Wonderful.

22 ounce bottle.  Thanks Cameron!  Pours black with a nice tan head.  Aroma of malt, chocolate, vanilla, and fruit.  Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruit, coffee, and a bit of smoke.  Excellent.

Draught @ CBC 2013: Pitch black coloured. Dense brown head. Aroma: cocoak, roast, molasses, coffee, some brown sugar. Flavour. Cococa, coffee, light smoke, some liqourice, chocolate. MEdium to full bodied. Ends heavy roasted bitter.
Draught at CBC. Creamy lightbrown excellent fully lasting head. Black colour. MOderate malty and hoppy aroma. Heavy biter wonderfull flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Excellent creamy palate.

Tap @ CBC. Black with medium brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, liquorice, little smoke, medium sweet, hop, meidum bitter and a little meat.

On tap at CBC, pours black with a small brown head. Aroma of loads of chocolate, a little roast and some hops. Flavour brings out loads of dark chocolate, a significant hoppiness, and roasted malt. Supremely complex and well-rounded. Quite hoppy for an impie stout. Delicious stuff.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2013 Tap @ CBC2013, small sample. Dark color, short head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and chocolat, but then with extra figs, mint or coconut. Bit too sweet in taste besides the medium bitterness. Cool to see its fermented with a lager yeast. 3.7
Bottle @ Beer Temple, large sample. Very creamy oatmeal, coffee, dark chocolate, hint of molasses. Smooth and creamy texture. Clean bitterness and yeast profile. Well balanced brew. Upping the score a bit to 4.0

CBC. Black with a big and lasting dark brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and coffee. Flavor is quite sweet and very bitter. Dry and roasted very bitter finish with warming alcohol. Smooth. 030513

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2013 Sampled @ CBC 2013. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized dark brown head. Smell roasted malts, lightly coffee, lightly hops. Taste malts, roasted malts, coffee, bitter, slightly hops, lightly chocolate. Lovely balance, thick oily texture, long lingering bitter finish, full body, nice suitable carbonation. Superb beer!

From tap, CBC 2013. Beautiful black with a dense brown head. High malty, riasted, with notes of chocolate and licorice. Very smooth flavor, sweet and light bitter, with a lingering bitter, slightly salty finish and a creamy, velvety texture. Full body. Lovely.
Tap at CBC 2013.  Pours black with a brown head.  Aroma off coffee, chocolate, dark fruits and caramel.  Flavor is heavy sweet and moderate bitter.  Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Draught @ CBC2013. Pours a pitch black colour with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate biscuit and hay. Flavour of roasted malts, biscuit, floral hops and wood. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a roasty, sweet, licorice finish. Good.

Sample @ CBC13.
Pours pitch bl color with a medium sized beige head. Aroma of mild hops, roasted malts, chocolate and vanilla. Flavour of roasted malts, dark chocolate, vanilla, tar and dark berries. Complex, yet balanced dark stout. Reminds me of nögne is. Nice.
3326

Draught @ CBC 2013
Pours pitch black with a sticky brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, wood, chocolate and cocoa. Taste is sweetish with syrup, wood, roasted malts and hcocolate. Finish is roasty and sweet iwht syrupy notes. Quite tasty, btu a tad sweet and sticky IS.

Black with dark tan head, about a finger. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, brown sugar, roasted malt. Taste is balanced coffee bitter with hints of smoke and a sweet alcohol finish. Full bodied and creamy with flat carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nose; smoke, dark fruit, coffee, liqourice. Taste is smoke, vanilla, coffee, muscovado sugar, honey. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at CBC 2013. Pitch black beer with a brownish head. Roasted chocolate aroma, caramel, cocoa, licorice, vanilla, dades, raisins, soot, tar notes. Roasted coffee flavor, dark chocolate, cocoa powder, raisins, dades, vanilla, soot, tar, some warming alcohol. Full bodied and with a nice roasted coffee finish.

Pitch dark , smooth brown head. Roasted malts and dry. Malts in the aroma. Fla or is quite intense. Roasted mats, very roasted, almost citrusdy, wood, sweet notes, complex a dry and her well tasting stout.

Shared bottle with Jan Magnus at Cafe Viking, Copenhagen. Pours pitch black with a small tanned head. Aroma of chocolate and liquorice, promising. Smooth and thick mouthfeel, velvety, Coffee and liquorice with a nice bitterness. Very good.

Good taste with a rich dark color even in the froth.  Just a hint of the alcohol and an overall smooth finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Robust, smoky aroma has licorice, coffee, molasses, caramel and semi-sweet chocolate notes. Pours a rich, warm sable a fleas eyebrow above black with a thick, fine-bubbled and rather persistent tan head. Hearty flavor has a strong smoky malt overtone that ushers in chocolate, coffee, caramel, nutty, earthy and subtle licorice notes that boogie on your tongue and stay long after the beer has gone down the pipes. Firm, smooth, oily texture is fairly fizzy, though the tingle does not persist the way the flavors do. Somewhat bitter hops make their appearance only in the final act, the bitterness nicely balancing the chocolaty sweetness. This is indeed a monster - monstrously delicious!

Slutfest!  Black, dark tan head.  Smooth milk chocolate aroma.  Flavor is dark chocolate and coffee, hint of dark fruit lingering in the background.  Rich and smooth, a very nice beer.  One of the highlights of the day for me.
Slutfest 2013: Charred oak nose. Black, thin beige head. Walnut flavor, prune present, very rich. Charred oak finish. Full body. Quite well rounded.

Aromas of roasty malts, chocolate, vanilla, and nutty tones.  Dark brown-black with a small, tan head.  Mostly dry with hints of malty sweetness, quite a savory beer.  Medium-full bodied with average carbonation, and finishes with pleasant, clean, roasty flavors.

Bomber from the brewery. Pours a dark brown 

color with a thin tan head. Fair head retention. 

Aroma of vanilla, chocolate, roasted malts. The 

taste is bitter roasted malts, grapes, vanilla, 

stone fruits, bitter hops. Medium bodied.
Aroma of roasted cocoabrown, minimal head, brown foam, medium sweetness, full body, creamy, long finish,
From a 22 oz bottle shared at home on Easter.  Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of toasted malt.  Licorice, chocolate and espresso notes.  Really tasty.

Pours jet black with a big mocha head. Aroma of roast and chocolate. Taste is slightly bitter dark chocolate. Medium body, solid beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home.
Pitch black coloured with a huge brown head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of dark chocolate and cocoa powder.
Sweet and roasted flavour of dark chocolate and cocoa powder with notes of alcohol and hops.
Roasted and hoppy finish.

Black. Thick tan head. Sweet sugary aroma. Very sweet thick and choclaty. Smooth, bit boozy

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at Ølbutikken - thanks to Bonke. Pitch black - brown head. High chocolate. Fruity. Nice bitterness. Lovely smooth body. High malty. Coffee. Licorice. Lovely baltic stout !!

Bottle poured a black color with aromas of chocolate, roast, light earth, and some coffee.  Flavors are the same with cbocolate, and roast.  A very nice beer that did not have a boozy aftertaste.  Another solid beer from Westbrook.

Bottle share at Sybarite Pig. Black pour in snifter. Light dark tan head and thin lacing. Strong alcohol on the nose with chocolate, nuts, oak. Awesome creamy taste with vanilla, chocolate, nuts, coconut.

Bottle shared at Hunaphu Day. Black pour with a creamy tan head. Nose displays creamy chocolate, vanilla beans, espresso and earth. Nicely melded flavors that mimicked the aroma. Medium heavy bodied and low carbonation
Sampled at esbls.  Black.  Minimal head.  I smell very light tobacco.  It is tasted, too.  Some ash.  Hops are bigger than is evident.  Alcohol is well hidden.  Tasty.
black color, aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, same flavors, milk chocolate, ash, low carbonation, creamy, pretty enjoyable

A: Pours a pitch black color with a thick, dark mocha head forming on the pour. The retention is top notch. Sticky sheets of lace are left down the glass.

S: This is big beer. Super roasty with some fruity yeast in the periphery. Alcohol notes are present, but it doesnt detract from the roasted malts and big dark chocolate notes. Some cocoa powder is there as well.

T: A ton of roasted malts, some char and a touch of cocoa bean. Bitter dark chocolate with some light fruity yeast in the background. Definitely seems like an amped up Baltic porter due to the yeast strain. Enjoyable.

M: Low carbonation. Silky smooth across the palate. Medium bodied. Finish is chocolate and big roast.

O: This a big and roasty beer, but the yeast strain drops subtle hints that its still got some Baltic porter bloodlines at heart. Its pretty ready to go now with the booze well hidden. Dont really see this benefiting from any extended aging. Maybe a year if you want the robust roasted malts to die down a bit.

Serving type: bottle
At hunahpu day 2013! Dark black pour tan head dissipates. Sweet aroma then roast malts. Taste similar light coffee and burnt grains. Its okay worth drinking but dont search out for.

Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Nose and taste of tobacco, ash, heavy roasted dark chocolate, heavy roasted coffee, vanilla and dark fruit. Medium body. Bitter roasted chocolate and tobacco leaf finish.

Bottle from Hop City. Nice find. Thick black pour with a dense but quickly fading dark brown head. Very pretty. Aroma was very Baltic porter esque with big roasty malts and earthy hops. Somewhat of a lactose presence in the nose and finish. Flavors were welcoming and actually somewhat subtle. The subtle ness was actually quite nice and made this way drinkable and rather refreshing. Big roasted malts, coffee, light vanilla and a clean light bitter finish. The lager yeast gives this an almost delicate profile among the massive amounts of malt and hops. This was fantastic.

A very good stout, though not as thick as the thickest newer IS.  Lacey and black thicker looking body.  Smooth mouthfeel, with some bitterness in the finish. Chocolate and coffee well integrated. I would like more coffee, and more "Baltic" flavour. Very good drinkability.
Dougs bottle for his B day.

Black pour with a good sized mocha head.  Aroma of coffee and dark chocolate.  Bitter hopping up front, bittersweet chocolate, fresh ground coffee, dark fruit,.  Chewy mouthfeel, full body.  Big thanks to Doug.

Tap. Pours opaque black, large dark brown head, creamy, great lacing. Aroma is dark roasted malts and chocolate. Flavor is the same plus coffee, cocoa powder, little sweetness, medium bitterness. Full body.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2013 Glaçage à gâteau au chocolat liquide avec les attraits de la levure lager qui donne une fraîcheur et une clarté des saveurs. Torréfaction et malts rôti en vedette, vraiment solide.

On tap at Porter. Pours black with an extremely dark brown head that dissipates slowly to the edges and laces. Aroma has a combination of dark roasted malts and creamy chocolate with a hint of dark grain. Flavor starts with a bit of creamy dark chocolate that is joined by a strong dark roasted malt note.

22oz bottle. Poured a dark brown, almost black, color with a smaller sized off white head. Aromas of roast, chocolate, coffee, and some light vanilla. Tastes of coffee, roast, chocolate, some dark fruits, and some caramel.  Tobacco and ash. Medium alcohol in the finish.
Tres dark in colour. Caramel head. Chocolate smell with mocha coffee taste. Delicious. Tastes like the things that i love in life.
on tap, dark rich brown pour with dense khaki foam, aroma of chocolate and nutshell, very dry bitter chocolate flavor with roast espresso bean, heavy finish

Bomber. Pours deep black with a creamy, dark tan head. Moderate lacing. Aroma is chocolate, very dark roast espresso, and a bit of mint. Taste is dark chocolate mocha. Very rich but surprisingly (and pleasantly) dry. The higher ABV is rather subdued and really sneaks up. One of the best beers Ive had in awhile.
